detailsOfAchievement: The Genesaret Gospel Home was firstly started with the intention of being able to be a blessing to anyone who is in need within Mizoram and accordingly to any place elsewhere.Ever since the Home was established, it was meant for all sorts of people, young and old who were in need of care and protection, alcoholic, substance abusers and people having chronic illness. Slowly pacing up its path and making modifications along its path, when the year 2007turn up the Home changes its path of direction and was transformed into a home made for only children i.e., 18 years and below who were in need of care and protection. Ever since then, The Genesaret Gospel Home follows that path till-date and became the only Child Care Institution within the whole of Champhai District, Mizoram. Centering and focusing on children, the Home tried its best to guide the children towards becoming a blessing for theirfamily and also moralizing them in terms of religious belief, work ethics, faith, hope and becoming a good citizens. The Home has primary and middle section of school within its campus at present. The Government soon recognized their efforts and works; then the Home received funds for school buildings and more teachers were given to them. Maintaining their good results at Board Examination, when 2007 turn up, the Home school stood at the top amongst all other schools within Champhai District. Slowly growing, middle section was then started and is still runung strong. At present, the Genesaret Gospel Hiome School has 10 SSA teachers and 1 CSS (Hindi) teacher.

title: Grace Society
detailsOfAchievement: Grace Society NGO Achievemnet Grace Society is a Church based Organization set up by the Mizoram Baptist Women Fellowship (MBKHP), to address the various social problems existing in the society. The organization mainly deals with the increasing problems of HIV/AIDS & Drug/Substance abuse in the community, in the field of Prevention, Intervention, Care and Support and Rehabilitation. It also deals with various women and children issues and addresses other vulnerable areas of the society. The organization has been working in Targeted Intervention programme since 2000, beginning with intervention among Commercial Sex Workers, followed by Core Composite of FSW & IDU in 2008, and with MSM and Spouses of IDU adding to the intervention since 2010. Mission Statement: 1) To create a better, healthier and harmonious society by reducing HIV/AIDS and Drug/Substance abuse in the society. 2) Economic empowerment of PLWHA and drugs victims, by providing rehabilitation through skill training and Income Generating Programme. 3) Social and economic upliftment of destitute women. 4) Promoting and facilitating behaviour change among those practicing high-risk behaviour and people living with HIV/AIDS. Vision/Goal: To create a better, harmonious, healthier society and improved economic condition by reducing HIV/AIDS and addiction in the community. Objectives: Increase awareness on HIV/AIDS and addiction among general population as well as high risk/marginalized communities, intervention to promote behavior change and harm reduction among high risk group, providing care and support to the affected, detoxification/de-addiction and rehabilitation through skill building, capacity building to enhance service delivery. 1. Targeted Intervention among FSW, IDU, MSM, & Spouses of IDU â€“ Sponsored by MSACS, the programme includes peer education and outreach, focus group discussion, awareness, community events, STI clinic & general healthcare, abscess management, counseling, condom promotion, needle syringe exchange programme, referral to ICTC, ART, TB/DOTS centre, crisis response and management, empowerment of community, advocacy. 2. Integrated Program on drugs & HIV/AIDS â€“ This mostly focus on aftercare program such as psycho-social support for recovering addicts through self help group meetings and support for income generation activities, educational support, support for skill development training to recovering addicts, care & support to PLWHA such as sponsorship for ART/Hospice referral, nutritional support to children of PLWHA, advocacy among church leaders, community leaders, school teachers & raising awareness among students, training among volunteers on sex and sexuality. This project is in partnership with TearAustralia. 3. Rehabilitation Center (Chhawmdawlna In) - This centre is set up by the Mizoram Baptist Women Fellowship in its own initiative the same time DIC was set up. Today the Rehab Centre can accommodate 30 boys and 20 girls at a time. It offers services like detoxification, Counseling, Meditation, Healthcare, Work therapy (including vegetable/flower gardening, Pig rearing, Dairy farming, Candle making etc), Physical Activity (Volleyball, badminton, table tennis) Rehabilitation through Skills training (including Electronics repairing, Bamboo craft, Carpentry, Tailoring and Flower making), Library, non-formal education to school going inmates.These programs besides TI are somewhat filling in the gaps that are not covered under TI. Each project complements and supplements each other. Having both DIC and Rehab is advantageous for target population in terms of referrals (as DIC clients are being referred to the Rehab for detox/deaddiction and rehabilitation while inmates released from Rehab are followed up from DIC). 4. Mental Health Program : One of the new project taken up by the NGO since 1st April , 2016 under National Health Mission in collaboration with National Mental Health Program.The Program mainly ensure the availability and accessibility of minimum mental health care for all in the foreseeable future particularly to the most vulnerable and underprivileged section of the population to encourage application of mental health knowledge in general health care and in social development and to promote community participation in mental health service development by organizing many awareness campaign & free clinic to reduce suicidal tendency in various department,school,colleges,church and sectors. 5. Home Visit, Nutritional & PLWH Support : Besides TI project, NGO give important to the client that almost every year the staff/NGO conducted house to house visit program trying to identify all hidden client and aware of each clients health condition so that follow â€“up program can be easily done as per client condition. Also, NGO continues significant ministry by giving nutritional support to positive child and rendering service and care to the positive client whose condition are in below average normal life to elevate their Condition.This support for nutritional and PLWHA mostly comes from charity and donation.

ngoName: MARA T T CHAKO AND ABRAHAM CHARITABLE TRUST
address: MARA T T CHAKO AND ABRAHAM CHARITABLE TRUST, LOTAI via TUIPANG PO, ZAWNGLING
title: MARA T T CHAKO AND ABRAHAM CHARITABLE TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: The Mara T.T. Chako & Abraham Charitable Trust (MTCA) is a non profit Organization (a NGO) registered under the Indian Registration Act of 1908 and legally came into existence on May 19, 2008 vide Document No: D 100(M) at Aizawl, Mizoram. Right from its inception, this Trust has been promoting welfare among the Mara Tribal Children and Women living in the MARA AUTONOMOUS DISTRICT COUNCIL, also known as Saiha District, one of the most backward Districts in Mizoram. One of our most important programmes is Special Education and Rehabilitation to Special Children (Mentally and Physically Challenged). Over the past years, the MARY HECHIA RESIDENTIAL SCHOOL ( A unit of the MTCA Charitable Trust ) has been imparting Special Education and Rehabilitation in a place not ideal and user friendly. The Children in need of Special Education and Rehabilitation are more in these communities. Other specific activities of the Trust are improving the Healthcare standards of the impoverished Mara and other Tribal people, empowerment of women etc. From a humble beginning with an enrollment of 15 Special Children in 2008, the MARY HECHIA RESIDENTIAL SPECIAL SCHOOL is today extending Special Education and Rehabilitation to 35 Special Children from 7 Village Councils in the Mara Autonomous District Council, one of the 3 Autonomous District Councils out of the 8 Districts in Mizoram. Still many more children and people with disabilities need our support and services but we are not in a position to do so due to lack of facilities and infrastructure. The cost of running the above Special School including providing food, clothing and hostel facilities to the above mentioned Special Children are met entirely by the Charitable Trust. In this context, we would like to mention that the MTCA Charitable Trust does not enjoy any financial support from either the District, State nor the Central Government towards the running of the Special School and is wholly dependent and supported by well wishers and donations ( in kind/cash ) from friends and relatives of the Board of Trustees. With a view of creating equal opportunities for our Children with Disabilities, we approached the District Administration and the Deputy Commissioner, Saiha as early as in May and November 2008 respectively. The Mara Autonomous District Council (MADC), after proper verification and being satisfied with our integrity and bonafides, allotted 2.455 hectaresâ€™of land at Zawngling, Saiha vide their Land Donation Certificate dated 13-05-2008, for the construction of the Special School and a Hospital subsequently for the Mentally and Physically Challenged. They have been feeling the acute need of a Special School for a long time as the only other Special School is the Gilead Special School run by the Spastic Society of Mizoram at Aizawl, the State Capital in the northern part of Mizoram. Although, the MARY HECHIA RESIDENTIAL SPECIAL SCHOOL ( A unit of the M.T.C.A. Charitable Trust ) was initially started as a Special School for Special Children of the age group from 5-18, it now includes Tribal persons with disabilities of all ages within its vicinity, with separate blocks, due to the following reasons: 1) There is no other Special School or Government Institution/Organisations in South Mizoram namely the Mara, Lai or Chakma Autonomous District Councils addressing the issue of Disability and the ONLY other Special School is in Aizawl, the State Capital in the northern part of Mizoram which is a laborious and expensive journey. 2) The prevailing high density of Disabilities of the Tribal people in the Mara Autonomous District Council ( also known as Saiha District in Mizoram ) necessitated the opening up of our Special School to Special Children of all ages, taking into consideration their poverty and pathetic state of affairs with no one to willing to take care or look after their welfare. Most of these Tribal Special Children and persons are known and related to each other either by marriage or through their Tribal clans. 3) We are the only N.G.O. catering to the need of the people with Disabilities in South Mizoram.
